alert.note: Alert for Chattooga; Floyd (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 6:23AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Floyd and south central Chattooga Counties through 700 AM EDT... At 623 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Fullerton to Moshat, and moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Rome, Cave Spring, Shannon, Pinson, Lindale and Coosa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM EDT for northwestern Georgia.
